docs.snippet: Brazil's continuation of strict import controls is reflected in its rise of $3,700,000 in its draft indebtedness last month, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. The rise, the bank explained, brought the total to a new high of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's continuation of strict import controls is reflected in its rise of $3,700,000 in its draft indebtedness last month, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. The rise, the bank explained, brought the total to a new high of $199,000,000, but it was the smallest monthly increase this year.
docs.abstract: NY Reserve Bank Aug collections rept

headline.main: RISE IN DRAFT DEBT OF BRAZIL SHRINKS; $3,700,000 Gain in August Reflects Import Controls, Reserve Bank Says

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Sept. 25 (AP) -- Argentina's low wheat production is causing a serious drain on Brazil's dollar exchange.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Sept. 25 (AP) -- Argentina's low wheat production is causing a serious drain on Brazil's dollar exchange.
docs.abstract: Argentina's temporary suspension of wheat exports forces Brazil to buy in US, draining dollar surplus; talks with Argentina under way; statistics on Argentina's role as supplier

headline.main: BRAZIL IS PINCHED ON EXPORT BARTER; Low Argentine Wheat Crop Forces Buying From U. S., With Dollar Drain a Result

docs.snippet: Hugh Gibson, director of the Provisional Intergovernmental Committee for the Movement of Migrants from Europe, said yesterday in an interview that several South American countries were definitely interested in absorbing as much as they could of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hugh Gibson, director of the Provisional Intergovernmental Committee for the Movement of Migrants from Europe, said yesterday in an interview that several South American countries were definitely interested in absorbing as much as they could of Europe's surplus population of 5,000,000. Mr. Gibson cited Venezuela, Brazil, Chile, Paraguay, Uruguay and "possibly Argentina."
docs.abstract: Gibson returns from S Amer; repts several nations would admit surplus Eurs; sees Eurs interested; to rept to inter-govt com

headline.main: LATIN NATIONS SEEN WANTING MIGRANTS; Hugh Gibson, Back From Tour, Finds Farm Work Available for 'Surplus' Europeans
Gainza Paz Flying to U. S.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 29 -- Imposition of import fees to raise the price of foreign wool to that which the Government guarantees American sheep raisers was urged today before the Tariff Commission. C. J. Fawcett of the National Wool Marketing...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 29 -- Imposition of import fees to raise the price of foreign wool to that which the Government guarantees American sheep raisers was urged today before the Tariff Commission. C. J. Fawcett of the National Wool Marketing Corporation, Boston, joined with spokesmen for the National Wool Growers Association in asking an import fee to supplement the present 25 1/2 cents a pound tariff.
docs.abstract: tariff rise on imports to meet domestic price support levels urged by C J Fawcett, others

headline.main: Wool Growers Call for Tariff Rise; World Group Sees Scarcity Over; WOOL GROWERS ASK INCREASE IN TARIFF

docs.snippet: Tonight the moon will be full; scattered across the United States, and in Mexico, Canada and Puerto Rico, bird watchers at some two hundred stations -- local weather conditions permitting -- will be on the lookout for birds on the wing.

docs.snippet: The nation's largest liner, the United States, became the home of the Naval Reserve's first shipboard unit yesterday.

docs.snippet: The long awaited "procedure" for Quartermaster purchasing of wool products under the "Buy American" provision, released last week by the Munitions Board, should open the road for substantial wool purchases in the immediate future.
docs.lead_paragraph: The long awaited "procedure" for Quartermaster purchasing of wool products under the "Buy American" provision, released last week by the Munitions Board, should open the road for substantial wool purchases in the immediate future.

headline.main: RULING OPENS WAY FOR WOOL BUYING; Quartermaster's 'Procedure' Expected to Lead to New Purchases Soon
